title: THE PERFECTION (2019) Is Far From Perfect
author: Think Story
comment: I felt like the rap song that came on during the revenge scene kind of messed up the tone of the movie for a little I would have preferred the classical music to continue to play.
I actually enjoyed this movie. Its not everyone’s cup of tea but I think the twists were very mindfucking.

To me this movie made so much sense that I could see every twist coming.

I don't know if I have to check myself into a mental institute now.

Didn't have any real issues with this movie. It's made in the same vague way many artsty style over substance movies of this type are. Once you let go of western interpretations of how a scary movie should be you'll have fun with what the movie attempts to put out.  The movie is made much in the vein as nonsensical Dario Argento movies are made, where it creates a narrative that is supported by the rules of the world.  For example, when you go see a common superhero flick there's a gap of disbelief where you're supposed to just accept that heroes instead of wearing armor opt for spandex rather than full protection, it's just one of the hard truths of that universe.  Once you start to try to make logical
description:
In this video I review and breakdown Netflix's latest horror film "The Perfection" starring Allison Williams. I really had no idea what was going on for most of the movie so enjoy the memes!
